reviewText: Long drawn out game and not fun to play at all. It doesn't have a tutorial or introduction of any kind, and trying to figure it out on your own only reveals that it's a boring, slow-paced and uninteresting. Definitely not worth the time, effort, or money.
voteText: 8 of 8 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: I thought it would be like the sims with animals, but there isn't anything to do in this game. Just wait. And it's impossible to accelerate the time...
voteText: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This game doesn't even work on my PC ( windows 8.1). Do not pick this up, in any shape or form. The graphics and textures are really bad, it does definitly shows its age.

Pro's:
+ Might have some drawbacks to your childhood

Con's:
- Bad graphics
- Poor options menu
- Some actions you have to preform will not work
- To long and no way to speed it up

date: players of all generations recieve just what they paid for: Over 300+ hours of animal-filled thrills!\n\nWith every second I sat in front of my screen monitoring the behaviour of each of my individual furry companions
recommended: I could sense a greater bond forming between myself and the creatures of the game. Over the course of many hours
voteText: each virtual animal became more than just that. They became my true friends. My family. I return home from work at the soup kitchen every evening
helpfulPercent: perspiring with the anticipation of greeting my fictional buddies on my Personalised Computer.\n\nWhat initially struck me as interesting was the strength in dialogue throughout many levels of this elaborate masterpiece. Taking into account the story lacking a proper introduction and furthermore a real tutorial to aid the transition into the role of the "Pet Hotel Manager"
votesHelpful: the script the key characters followed in most cutscenes was by far the most creative and innovative i have witnessed in the past few years. Normally I enter willingly into a virtual world such as this to be met with an immersive and heart-stopping environment
votesTotal: but this was something else. The next-generation game engine which "My Pet Hotel" is run on exceeds that of any engine I have ever seen before in my many decades of pet-managing.\n\nThe unique flare within each detail and development I have encountered in my 7 playthroughs has led me to understand that each twist and turn in the plot leads to even greater story development
votesFunny: and when you thought that the story material had exceeded its limitations then something extraordinary emerges from the depths of "My Pet Hotel" to stun the player. Delivering an emotional punch to each player in their initial journey through the mystical world
commentsCount: this chilling and delicious rendition of its original 1986 work of art does not fail to deliver on the reminiscent euphoria I felt myself victim to as a young lad.\n\nWith all things considered
column16: my encounter with "My Pet Hotel" has left me personally with a greater longing for a sequel than I have felt for many releases in the past. Who knows what this untapped vein of virtual gold holds for the future of all video gaming
column22: 4 of 11 people (36%) found this review helpful 5 people found this review funny
